content:
Diagnosis:
T1N0M0 adenocarcinoma of right parotid gland

Surgery:
15 January 2024 - Right superficial parotidectomy

Histology:
Grade 2 adenocarcinoma, HER2 negative, clear margins (>5mm), no lymphovascular invasion

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g bd
Ramipril 5mg od

Current situation:
Routine 3-month follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the head and neck follow-up clinic. She has recovered well from her surgery with no facial nerve weakness. The surgical site has healed well with minimal scarring. She reports no new symptoms and examination today shows no evidence of recurrence. Her latest MRI from 12 April 2024 confirms no evidence of disease. Blood tests are satisfactory.

The plan is to continue regular surveillance. I will arrange follow-up in 3 months with repeat imaging at 6 months as per protocol.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Grade 2 adenocarcinoma, clear margins (>5mm), no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: MRI shows no evidence of disease

patient_facts.value: No facial nerve weakness, surgical site well healed with minimal scarring, no evidence of recurrence

status_updates.value: Early stage parotid adenocarcinoma treated with surgery. Good post-operative recovery with no evidence of recurrence at 3 months
Repeat imaging at 6 months as per protocol
Follow-up in head and neck clinic in 3 months
